title: Neuro Psychometric Alignment of LATAM Engineering Talent in AI Augmented Pipelines (2026 to 2036)
asset_url: /Neuro Psychometric Alignment of LATAM Engineering Talent in AI Augmented Pipelines (2026 to 2036).pdf
summary: This preprint argues that resume-based engineering hiring is statistically unreliable in AI-augmented software environments and that latent cognitive traits are more predictive of retention and contribution than static skill indicators. Using TeamStation Cortex 3.0.0 across the LATAM-US nearshore corridor, the study reports materially better hiring quality and outcome prediction under calibrated neuro-psychometric evaluation.
key_findings: Static skill indicators had near-zero predictive power for job performance, retention, and system contribution.
Latent traits such as Architectural Instinct, Problem Solving Agility, Learning Orientation, and Collaborative Cognition explained most observed variance in six-month outcomes.
False-positive hiring errors decreased from approximately 42% under human screening to 8% under Cortex evaluation.
False-negative screening errors decreased from approximately 35% to 4%.
Six-month retention prediction improved from R^2 about 0.15 (human evaluation) to R^2 about 0.72 (Cortex evaluation).
Language calibration removed major second-language bias effects; translation latency was estimated to account for about 35% of rejected high-quality LATAM candidates.
methodology_relevance: Provides a quantitative validation framework for benchmarking talent-evaluation systems in AI-augmented engineering pipelines, including outcome-linked metrics (false positive/negative rates, retention prediction), language-bias calibration, and psychometric signal extraction methods that can be mapped directly into benchmark validation criteria.

title: TeamStation AI Official Domain & Subdomain Architecture Document
summary: Canonical governance document defining TeamStation primary domain, subdomain roles, strategic rationale, and rules for new domain initiatives.
key_findings: Hub-and-spoke domain model is mandatory for intent separation and authority compounding.
Subdomain boundaries are treated as operating model controls, not cosmetic URL choices.
New initiatives must map to an existing subdomain or justify a new one with explicit non-overlapping semantics.
methodology_relevance: Provides governance constraints for benchmark subsite semantics, cross-linking, and intent isolation.

title: TeamStation Internal Link Inventory
summary: Inventory of hub-and-spoke internal links across TeamStation articles, research, CTO by-country pages, and hire technology pages used for benchmark cross-domain authority routing.
key_findings: Internal link clusters are explicitly segmented by intent and audience.
Benchmarks subsite routes links to articles, research, CTO, and hire properties by topic relevance.
Cluster-level URL volumes support scale planning for 500-page benchmark architecture.
methodology_relevance: Defines cross-domain internal linking controls for benchmark page modules and SEO authority flow.
